Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning
Jazz Chisholm Jr. put the Yankees ahead with a go-ahead run in the top of the 10th inning
Pre-Game Insights: The team that has won Game 1 has gone on to win the World Series 24 of the last 30 times.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'Tonight, the game honored him.' referring to Freeman's performance.
Aaron Judge said, 'Itâ€™s time to go to work.' after the loss.
Manager Aaron Boone expressed confidence in his team's ability to bounce back.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Joe Davis compared Joe Davis's call to Vin Scully's call of Kirk Gibson's iconic home run in 1988.
Dodgers players stayed on the field for 20 minutes after the game to watch Freeman's grand slam.
Others: Juan Soto misplayed a fly ball, allowing Ohtani to score from third.
Gleyber Torres's throw short-hopped second base, allowing Ohtani to score from third.
Nestor Cortes had not pitched since September 18th.
